item.title: OIRA Insight, Reform, and Accountability Act

latestAction.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 234 - 180 (Roll no. 116). (text: CR 1403-1404)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 234 - 180 (Roll no. 116).(text: CR 1403-1404)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 233 - 189 (Roll no. 115). (consideration: CR H1408, H1419-1420)
Considered as unfinished business. (consideration: CR H1419-1421)

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on H.Res. 156, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Polis demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings on ordering the previous question until later in the legislative day.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 156.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H1403-1408)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 14.
Providing for consideration of H.R. 1004 and H.R. 1009.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 115-21, by Mr. Sessions.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 115-21, by Mr. Sessions.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1004) to amend chapter 3 of title 5, United States Code, to require the publication of information relating to pending agency regulatory actions, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1009) to amend title 44, United States Code, to require the Administrator of the Office of Information and Regulatory Affairs to review regulations.

bill.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1004) to amend chapter 3 of title 5, United States Code, to require the publication of information relating to pending agency regulatory actions, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1009) to amend title 44, United States Code, to require the Administrator of the Office of Information and Regulatory Affairs to review regulations, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
